complexity_and_exceptions.title: This section is tangled and fragile
complexity_and_exceptions.summary: Complex code that hides errors is the #1 source of surprise crashes. This is fixable â€” untangling one usually makes the other easier too.
complexity_and_exceptions.why: When logic is hard to follow and errors are silently swallowed, bugs hide in exactly the places you can't see.

action.text: Start with the exceptions â€” making errors visible often simplifies the code naturally.

complexity_and_exceptions.footer: Fixing one usually helps the other.

global_state_and_exceptions.title: Shared data with hidden error paths
global_state_and_exceptions.summary: Variables that change during error handling create the sneakiest bugs. This is fixable â€” a small change makes a big difference.
global_state_and_exceptions.why: When an exception fires, shared data may be left half-updated. The next function reads stale data â€” everything looks fine until it doesn't.

action.text: Wrap shared-data changes in try/finally blocks, or pass data explicitly.

global_state_and_exceptions.footer: Small change, big reliability gain. Come back to this when you're ready.

security_and_dead_code.title: Dead code is hiding a security concern
security_and_dead_code.summary: There's a security-related issue in code that isn't being used. This is common â€” removing the dead code removes the risk entirely.
security_and_dead_code.why: Unused code with security issues is like an unlocked door in a room you forgot about.

action.text: Check if the dead code is truly unused, then remove it.

security_and_dead_code.footer: Less code = fewer surprises. Totally fine to leave for now.
